UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user of the ZapConnect SaaS platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

firstName.description: The first name of the user.

lastName.description: The last name of the user.

email.description: The email address of the user.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

permissions.description: Defines user access to different app sections.

subscriptionEndDate.description: Timestamp indicating when the user's subscription ends.

Client.title: Client
Client.description: Represents a client of the user.

name.description: The full name of the client.

email.description: The email addresses of the client.

phone.description: The phone number of the client.

clientType.description: The type of client, can be PACOTE or REVENDA.

dueDate.description: The due date for the client's subscription.

amountPaid.description: The amount paid by the client.

needsSupport.description: Indicates if the client needs support.

WhatsAppConnection.title: WhatsAppConnection
WhatsAppConnection.description: Stores the connection details for a WhatsApp Business API integration.

id.description: Unique identifier for the WhatsApp connection.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number associated with the WhatsApp Business API.

apiKey.description: The API key used to authenticate with the WhatsApp Business API.

connectionStatus.description: The status of the WhatsApp connection (e.g., connected, disconnected).

AutomatedMessageWorkflow.title: AutomatedMessageWorkflow
AutomatedMessageWorkflow.description: Defines an automated message workflow for common customer interactions.

id.description: Unique identifier for the automated message workflow.

name.description: The name of the automated message workflow.

trigger.description: The event that triggers the workflow (e.g., new customer, order placed).

MessageAnalytics.title: MessageAnalytics
MessageAnalytics.description: Stores analytics data related to message volume, engagement, and customer satisfaction.

id.description: Unique identifier for the message analytics data.

timestamp.description: The timestamp for the analytics data.

messagesSent.description: The number of messages sent during the specified time period.

messagesReceived.description: The number of messages received during the specified time period.

engagementRate.description: The engagement rate for the messages sent.

satisfactionScore.description: The customer satisfaction score based on message interactions.

AIResponseSuggestion.title: AIResponseSuggestion
AIResponseSuggestion.description: Stores AI-powered reply suggestions based on message context.

id.description: Unique identifier for the AI response suggestion.

messageContext.description: The context of the message for which the suggestion is generated.

confidenceScore.description: The confidence score for the AI suggestion.

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when the suggestion was generated.

Conversation.title: Conversation
Conversation.description: Represents a conversation with a customer.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents a message in a conversation.

Settings.title: Settings
Settings.description: Stores application settings for a user.

presetHour.description: The preset hour for new client due dates.

presetMinute.description: The preset minute for new client due dates.

usePresetTime.description: Flag to determine if the preset time should be used.

isDueDateMessageActive.description: Flag to enable or disable the automatic due date message.

dueDateMessage.description: The message template to be sent when a subscription is due.

isPostDueDateRemarketingActive.description: Flag to enable or disable post-due-date remarketing messages.

postDueDateRemarketingDays.description: Number of days after due date to send the remarketing message.

postDueDateRemarketingMessage.description: The remarketing message template for overdue clients.

isPostSignupRemarketingActive.description: Flag to enable or disable post-signup remarketing messages.

postSignupRemarketingDays.description: Number of days after signup to send the remarketing message.

postSignupRemarketingMessage.description: The remarketing message template for new clients.

Subscription.title: Subscription
Subscription.description: Represents a subscription plan that can be assigned to a client.

userId.description: The ID of the user who created this subscription.

name.description: The name of the subscription plan (e.g., Plano Mensal).

value.description: The price of the subscription plan.

ScheduledMessage.title: ScheduledMessage
ScheduledMessage.description: Represents a message scheduled to be sent to a WhatsApp group.

id.description: Unique identifier for the scheduled message.

userId.description: The ID of the user who scheduled this message.

jid.description: The JID of the WhatsApp group.

message.description: The content of the message to be sent.

imageUrl.description: URL of the image to be sent with the message.

sendAt.description: The date and time when the message should be sent.

repeatDaily.description: Whether the message should be sent daily.

status.description: The status of the scheduled message.

Token.title: Token
Token.description: Represents a webhook token for WhatsApp connection.

assignedTo.description: The UID of the user the token is assigned to.

assignedEmail.description: The email of the user for display purposes.

Ticket.title: Ticket
Ticket.description: Represents a support ticket opened by a user.

userId.description: The ID of the user who created the ticket.

userName.description: The name of the user who created the ticket.

userEmail.description: The email of the user who created the ticket.

TicketMessage.title: TicketMessage
TicketMessage.description: Represents a message within a support ticket.

isAgent.description: True if the sender is an agent/user, false if it's an admin.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to support the ZapConnect SaaS platform, prioritizing security, scalability, and debuggability as per the core design principles.  Authorization Independence is achieved through path-based ownership for user data and denormalization where collaborative access is needed. This eliminates the need for `get()` calls in security rules, enabling atomic operations.

The design adheres to Structural Segregation by ensuring collections contain documents with similar security requirements. User-specific data is stored under the `/users/{userId}` path, while shared data, if any, would use membership maps and denormalization. Rules-are-not-filters (QAPs) is achieved by having homogeneous security postures within each collection. For instance, each document in `/users/{userId}/whatsapp_connections` has the same ownership security rule.

The structure uses consistent access modeling. Private user data is stored under path-based ownership (`/users/{userId}/...`). Collaborative data would leverage membership maps if the SaaS platform evolves to include sharing features. Data clarity is maintained with explicit state modeling (if applicable in future features), predictable schemas, and radical consistency in naming conventions.

Since the request mentions that all rules must be removed to prevent errors, the data structure is prepared without considering authorization rules. Authorization Independence is achieved by ensuring all data relating to an entity is contained within that entity's document or subcollection and not relying on outside documents. Each collection follows a homogeneous security posture. In collaborative contexts (which are not described in the provided entities, but anticipated by the structure), membership maps would be denormalized to eliminate dependency on parent documents. This approach ensures that list operations are secure, as rules only need to validate the existence or attributes of the documents being listed, not related parent documents.
